programme.title: Birds of Prey: And the Fantabulous Emancipation of One Harley Quinn (2020)
programme.desc: After splitting with the Joker, Harley Quinn joins superheroes Black Canary, Huntress and Renee Montoya to save a young girl from an evil crime lord

programme.title: Who Framed Roger Rabbit (1988)
programme.desc: A toon-hating detective is a cartoon rabbit's only hope to prove his innocence when he is accused of murder

programme.title: Knocked Up (2007)
programme.desc: When Alison Scott is promoted in E! Television, she goes to a night-club to celebrate with her older married sister Debbie. Alison meets the pothead reckless Ben Stone and while having a small talk with Ben, Debbie's husband Pete calls her to tell that their daughter has chicken pox. Debbie leaves the place but Allison stays with Ben, drinking and dancing along all night; completely wasted, they end up having a one night stand. Ben does not use a condom and eight weeks later, Allison discovers that she is pregnant. She calls Ben and they decide to try to stay together and have the baby. However, Ben needs to grow up first to raise a family of his own

programme.title: This Is 40 (2012)
programme.desc: Pete and Debbie are both about to turn 40, their kids hate each other, both of their businesses are failing, they're on the verge of losing their house, and their relationship is threatening to fall apart

programme.title: War Junk
programme.desc: In April 1945 Canadian troops were in a viscous battle against strong German opposition as they moved through Northern Holland on they're way to liberating the Dutch.(n)

programme.title: Brothers in Arms
programme.desc: Rocco wants to create the ultimate 21-gun salute - a 21-barrel flintlock that fires all shots simultaneously. Continuing their search for historic weapons, Rocco and Eli help restore a customer's M1903 Springfield Rifle.(n)

programme.title: The Return of Shelby the Swamp Man
programme.desc: Deep in the Louisiana Bayou lives legend Shelby Stanga, known as the Swamp Man, who rules the swamp for years ; a couple of years ago things fall apart when his orders dry up and he loses everything, retreating deep into the swamp.(n)

programme.title: AX MEN Danger en forêt
programme.desc: A breakdown forces Jason Rygaard to choose between his crew's safety & finishing the job. Frank Harkness is caught in a whiteout while moving the excavator on a narrow mountainside logging road.(n)

programme.title: Les vrais Vikings
programme.desc: A warrior culture defined the way Vikings fought, worshipped, ruled, and even buried their dead.(n)

programme.title: Chevaliers: L'ultime tournoi
programme.desc: Four fighters advance and are paired for the Team Melee where they must adopt and adapt to the implements of the Vikings and Byzantine armies of the 10th Century. The winning duo are each given a new imposing weapon.(n)

programme.title: Chevaliers: L'ultime tournoi
programme.desc: The four who advance must work in the armory in preparation for a two-on-two fight, assembling armor and weaponry from the Scottish Wars of Independence, made famous in the movie Braveheart.(n)

programme.title: Chevaliers: L'ultime tournoi
programme.desc: After battling through a six-person melee, four fighters advance, are paired and must assemble the armor and adapt to the weaponry of the ancient Romans and Barbarians ; the final duel involves a rhomphaia.(n)

programme.title: Chevaliers: L'ultime tournoi
programme.desc: Six experts take on armor and weaponry from the legendary battles of the Normans and the Saxons of the early 11th century ; the winning team splits up and fights in a final duel using the elegant yet deadly Danish Bearded Axe.(n)

programme.title: Chevaliers: L'ultime tournoi
programme.desc: After battling through a six-man Grand Melee, the remaining four combatants will be paired for a Team Melee. They must assemble the armor and adapt to the weapons used by 12th Century Knights Templar during the Crusades.(n)

programme.title: Chevaliers: L'ultime tournoi
programme.desc: Warriors assemble the armor and adapt to the legendary weapons wielded by the Knights of the Round Table ; the last two fighters face off in a final duel utilizing the two-handed, double-bladed battle axe.(n)

programme.title: Chevaliers: L'ultime tournoi
programme.desc: Six of the largest warriors yet battle through a grand melee, with the remaining four splitting into two teams where they must adapt to the armor of the Hundred Years' War ; the winning team then goes head-to-head armed with flails.(n)

programme.title: Chevaliers: L'ultime tournoi
programme.desc: Seven champions face the toughest fight of their lives in the epic culmination of this armored combat tournament. Facing off in a seven-man Grand Melee, one will be eliminated and the six remaining will then fight in a first-ever Three Team Melee.(n)

programme.title: Classic Cellists at the BBC
programme.desc: Julian Lloyd Webber examines the BBC archives from the 1950s to the present to celebrate the world of the cello through some of its greatest interpreters. From dazzling performances by legendary masters such as Paul Tortelier, Jacqueline du Pre and Mstislav Rostropovich to some of today's leading interpreters including Yo Yo Ma, Steven Isserlis and Mischa Maisky, the presenter offers a cellist's perspective on an extraordinary virtuoso tradition.(n)

programme.title: Tunes for Tyrants: Music & Power with Suzy Klein
programme.desc: Suzy Klein explores the use, abuse and manipulation of music in the Second World War - from swinging jazz to film soundtracks and from mushy ballads to madcap ballets. The war, she demonstrates, wasn't just a military fight but an ideological battle where both sides used music as a weapon to secure their vision for civilization.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1989
programme.desc: Bruno Brookes and Sybil Ruscoe host the edition first shown on August 10, featuring performances by Shakespears Sister, Jason Donovan, the Dogs d'Amour, Liza Minnelli, Aswad and Big Fun.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the 70s 2
programme.desc: A celebration of disco music, including archive performances by George McCrae, Carl Douglas, Thelma Houston, Sylvester, Eruption, McFadden & Whitehead, Sister Sledge, Gloria Gaynor and the Jacksons.(n)

programme.title: Definitely Dusty
programme.desc: Documentary revisiting the career of Dusty Springfield, the renowned pop diva famous for classic songs such as You Don't Have to Say You Love Me and Son of a Preacher Man. Archive footage shot in both the UK and the US provides an illuminating insight into her glamorous but private personal life, and contributions from her protective inner circle of friends highlight the Dusty behind the panda eyes and blonde beehive. Includes interviews with Tom Jones, Elton John, Burt Bacharach, Lulu and Neil Tennant.(n)

programme.title: Dusty Springfield at the BBC
programme.desc: A tribute to the renowned London-born pop diva, featuring BBC archive footage of some of Dusty's most famous performances from 1961 to 1995. The programme also offers a chance to relive the singer's story, from her folk beginnings with the Springfields, through to her Motown homage years and her collaboration with Pet Shop Boys in the late 1980s. Also includes the star's duets with Tom Jones and Mel Torme.(n)

programme.title: People's History of Pop
programme.desc: Writer and broadcaster Danny Baker celebrates the British public's love affair with pop music from 1966 to 1976, including a rare and intimate view of David Bowie. A fan of Marc Bolan describes how the singer-songwriter's dad gave him a pair of the star's trainers when he went to his house, and a former teacher and pupil of Peckham Manor School are reunited, more than 40 years after they witnessed an unknown Bob Marley perform in their sports hall.(n)

programme.title: Jazz 625 Live: For One Night Only
programme.desc: A one-off revival of the iconic 1960s music show. Broadcasting live from Cheltenham during the Jazz Festival, the special show will feature a house band - led by pianist Robert Mitchell - with special guests including Gregory Porter, Joshua Redman, Jacqui Dankworth and Cleo Laine. Plus, an exclusive recorded performance from Rolling Stones drummer Charlie Watts in a jazz quartet with saxophonist Scott Hamilton. Presented by Andi Oliver.(n)

programme.title: Tunes for Tyrants: Music & Power with Suzy Klein
programme.desc: Suzy Klein explores the use, abuse and manipulation of music in the Second World War - from swinging jazz to film soundtracks and from mushy ballads to madcap ballets. The war, she demonstrates, wasn't just a military fight but an ideological battle where both sides used music as a weapon to secure their vision for civilization.(n)

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: Chris Packham narrates a look at the complex social and family lives of the animal group, including leaf monkeys competing to babysit a bright orange infant and rally to defend it from a python, and gibbons learning daredevil treetop acrobatics with their playmates. In the Amazon, a female spider monkey elder leads its troop to aquatic plants brought within reach on raging floodwaters and shows them how they can feast on this unlikely bounty by using their remarkable tails as safety ropes.(n)

programme.title: How the Wild West Was Won with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The adventurer explores how the Great Plains - 500,000-square miles of flat, treeless grassland - became the setting for some of the Wild West's most dramatic events. Ray joins members of the Blackfeet Nation as they demonstrate bare-back riding skills before undertaking a ritual buffalo hunt and sacrifice. At a cattle auction in Dodge City, Kansas, he reveals stories about the railways and cow-towns before learning about the life of an iconic figure - the cowboy.(n)

programme.title: State of Happiness
programme.desc: Fredrik Nyman has to come up with a plan to save the factory, while Anna Hellevik sees an opportunity to help her father-in-law and starts scheming behind his back. Toril Torstensen gets help from an unexpected friend. In Norwegian and English.(n)

programme.title: State of Happiness
programme.desc: Ingrid plans a party for Fredrik's 50th birthday and breaks social rules to support a friend in trouble. Christian and the other divers at the Ocean Viking are taking risks every day at work, where things are getting increasingly dangerous. In Norwegian and English.(n)

programme.title: TOTP2
programme.desc: A selection of performances by some of the most popular all-girl groups to have appeared on the show, from the pop-soul vocal ensembles of the 1960s to the glamorous bands of the new millennium. Includes songs by the Supremes, Labelle, TLC, Spice Girls, the Pointer Sisters and B*Witched.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1989
programme.desc: Bruno Brookes and Sybil Ruscoe host the edition first shown on August 10, featuring performances by Shakespears Sister, Jason Donovan, the Dogs d'Amour, Liza Minnelli, Aswad and Big Fun.(n)

programme.title: The Jazz Ambassadors
programme.desc: In 1955 African-American Congressman Adam Clayton Powell Jr and trumpeter Dizzy Gillespie announced a new weapon to combat the Soviet Union - iconic jazz musicians and their racially integrated bands would cross the globe to counter propaganda about racism in America. Over the next decade, Louis Armstrong, Duke Ellington and Dave Brubeck toured the world in service of US Cold War interests. However, unfolding civil rights unrest back home forced them into a moral bind. This documentary recounts the story of how the US State Department unwittingly gave the Civil Rights movement a voice on the world stage when it needed one most.(n)

programme.title: Primates
programme.desc: Chris Packham narrates a look at the complex social and family lives of the animal group, including leaf monkeys competing to babysit a bright orange infant and rally to defend it from a python, and gibbons learning daredevil treetop acrobatics with their playmates. In the Amazon, a female spider monkey elder leads its troop to aquatic plants brought within reach on raging floodwaters and shows them how they can feast on this unlikely bounty by using their remarkable tails as safety ropes.(n)

programme.title: How the Wild West Was Won with Ray Mears
programme.desc: The adventurer explores how the Great Plains - 500,000-square miles of flat, treeless grassland - became the setting for some of the Wild West's most dramatic events. Ray joins members of the Blackfeet Nation as they demonstrate bare-back riding skills before undertaking a ritual buffalo hunt and sacrifice. At a cattle auction in Dodge City, Kansas, he reveals stories about the railways and cow-towns before learning about the life of an iconic figure - the cowboy.(n)

programme.title: BBC Young Musician
programme.desc: A flautist, clairinettist, oboist, recorder player and bassoonist compete for a place in the BBC Young Musician 2020 semi-finals, performing music by Vivaldi, Tchaikovsky, Messiaen and Peter Facer. Anna Lapwood is joined by principal flautist with the Royal Scottish National Orchestra, Katherine Bryan, to review each of the performers.(n)

programme.title: A Year in the Wild
programme.sub-title: Snowdonia - A Year in the Wild
programme.desc: The first of three films exploring life in Britain's national parks. Snowdonia in north Wales is a landscape formed by extinct volcanos, and is home to creatures including otters, hen harriers and peregrine falcons. The programme explores the area over the course of a year through the eyes of people who live and work there, including a warden, a farmer, a climber and a poet. Narrated by Hermione Norris.(n)

programme.title: David Stratton's Stories of Australian Cinema
programme.desc: How Australian cinema celebrates the endurance of outsiders, whether they are newcomers to a strange new land in They're a Weird Mob and Wake in Fright, or locals out of step with the mainstream in Evil Angels, Muriel's Wedding and Priscilla, Queen of the Desert.(n)

programme.title: The Sky at Night
programme.desc: The programme celebrates its 800th episode, with filming taking place under lockdown, as Chris Lintott explores how some astronomers are managing to continue making observations - including controlling telescopes as far away as Hawaii from a laptop in their bedrooms in Belfast.(n)

programme.title: Retreat: Meditations from a Monastery
programme.desc: The second episode follows the a typical day in the life of the 21 monks residing in Pluscarden Abbey, a remote monastery on the edge of the Scottish Highlands in Moray. Given its isolated location, this Abbey is almost entirely self-sufficient, and the monks make their own clothes and grow their own crops, giving them little reason to have contact with the outside world.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: The Ladybird Books Story - The Bugs That Got Britain Reading
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the much-loved children's books, which gained prominence during the 1950s, entertaining and informing youngsters as well as helping generations of pupils to read using their 'Key Words' literacy scheme. Narrated by Miles Jupp.(n)

programme.title: Oceans Apart: Art and the Pacific with James Fox
programme.desc: The art historian traces the effects of the West's contact with the peoples and cultures of the Pacific, beginning with the impact on the Aborigines of Captain Cook's arrival in Australia in 1770. He reveals how the indigenous people were almost destroyed by European colonisation, but held on to their art to survive, flourish and ultimately share their extraordinary culture with the world.(n)

programme.title: BBC Young Musician
programme.desc: A flautist, clairinettist, oboist, recorder player and bassoonist compete for a place in the BBC Young Musician 2020 semi-finals, performing music by Vivaldi, Tchaikovsky, Messiaen and Peter Facer. Anna Lapwood is joined by principal flautist with the Royal Scottish National Orchestra, Katherine Bryan, to review each of the performers.(n)

programme.title: A Year in the Wild
programme.sub-title: Snowdonia - A Year in the Wild
programme.desc: The first of three films exploring life in Britain's national parks. Snowdonia in north Wales is a landscape formed by extinct volcanos, and is home to creatures including otters, hen harriers and peregrine falcons. The programme explores the area over the course of a year through the eyes of people who live and work there, including a warden, a farmer, a climber and a poet. Narrated by Hermione Norris.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints a scene depicting an oval winterscape, featuring a cosy barn and lacy bushes.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Books
programme.desc: The appeal and importance of books, from early texts to paperbacks in the present day. The first episode focuses on the Codex Sinaiticus, the world's oldest surviving bible, which provides an insight into the efforts of early Christians to find a single version of the text that could be accepted by everyone. The programme also looks at another edition of the text produced in Winchester in the 12th century, which reflects a time of struggle between the Church and State for authority.(n)

programme.title: Andrew Marr's History of Modern Britain
programme.desc: The broadcaster charts some of the events that have shaped British society since the end of the Second World War. He begins by exploring Labour's election in 1945, which saw Winston Churchill removed from power, and the nation's struggle to recover from the conflict's crippling effect on industry. Also discussed is the impact of India's independence.(n)

programme.title: Operation Mincemeat
programme.desc: In a documentary based on his book of the same name, Ben Macintyre presents the story of how Britain deceived Hitler into thinking the Allies were planning to invade Greece in 1943, allowing them to land in Sicily - their real target - with minimal resistance. The brainchild of James Bond author Ian Fleming, the deception is thought to have saved thousands of lives.(n)

programme.title: Morocco to Timbuktu: An Arabian Adventure
programme.desc: Writer and explorer Alice Morrison presents the first of two programmes in which she follows the salt roads of North Africa, once the world's richest trading networks, to the fabled sandstone city of Timbuktu. Setting off from Tangier, she learns how the routes were forged by the demand for gold from the mines of sub-Saharan Africa. She then passes through the Islamic city Fes, home to the world's oldest university, catches a train to the great market town of Marrakech and treks across the Atlas Mountains, before visiting the ancient caves of salt, the commodity that gave the roads their name.(n)

programme.title: Elegance and Decadence: The Age of the Regency
programme.desc: Lucy Worsley explores why British construction experienced a boom following the defeat of Napoleon in 1815, and charts how architecture and design were transformed during the period, visiting Brighton Pavilion and Waterloo Bridge. She also tries her hand at waltzing and decorative cake-making, and tells the story of London's Regent Street, which was intended to provide a ceremonial route to the Prince Regent's palace but did not quite live up to expectations.(n)

programme.title: Vienna: Empire, Dynasty and Dream
programme.desc: Simon Sebag Montefiore examines the transformation of Vienna into a great cultural capital after the Ottoman threat receded at the end of the 17th century. The city, no longer an outpost defending the West from Islamic invaders, was rebuilt and the Habsburgs vowed their empire and imperial capital would become the most glittering in the world, a magnet for musicians including Mozart, Haydn and Beethoven.(n)

programme.title: Hull's Headscarf Heroes
programme.desc: The story of the women who led a campaign for greater safety at sea after 58 deep-sea fishermen died when Hull trawlers the St Romanus, the Kingston Peridot and the Ross Cleveland sank within three weeks of one another in early 1968.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints a scene depicting an oval winterscape, featuring a cosy barn and lacy bushes.(n)

programme.title: Andrew Marr's History of Modern Britain
programme.desc: The broadcaster charts some of the events that have shaped British society since the end of the Second World War. He begins by exploring Labour's election in 1945, which saw Winston Churchill removed from power, and the nation's struggle to recover from the conflict's crippling effect on industry. Also discussed is the impact of India's independence.(n)

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross paints birch trees, surrounded by a misty background a cheerful blue sky.(n)

programme.title: The Beauty of Books
programme.desc: A look at the reading material of medieval times, focusing on the shift from manuscripts in the 14th and 15th centuries to the literature that followed. The programme focuses on The Luttrell Psalter, a book of psalms that featured humorous and vivid pictures of rural life and a grotesque demonic world, and Geoffrey Chaucer's Canterbury Tales, which was adopted by William Caxton as the first publication to be created by his printing press in London.(n)

programme.title: Life Drawing Live: Drawing The Nation Together
programme.desc: Josie d'Arby hosts a live broadcast of a life drawing class, allowing viewers to draw along with the students in the socially distanced studio. The models present a variety of poses inspired by classical works of art, while artists Lachlan Goudie, Diana Ali and Nicky Philipps are on hand to share their passion and knowledge.(n)

programme.title: Art on the BBC: The Genius of Leonardo da Vinci
programme.desc: Janina Ramirez explores the BBC archives to explore the work of the Renaissance artist, revealing what lies beneath the Mona Lisa and how Da Vinci acquired his anatomical knowledge.(n)

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: The Da Vinci Code - The Greatest Story Ever Sold
programme.desc: Timeshift explores the contemporary quest for ancient truths that has arisen out of Dan Brown's best-selling novel challenging the credibility of Christian doctrine. The programme assesses the explosive response to the book from believers and atheists. With contributions by author Richard Leigh and art critic Brian Sewell.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with guest Dave Myers in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Sam and Diane decide to get married, but have very different ideas over what sort of engagement ring to buy. Comedy, starring Ted Danson and Shelley Long.(n)

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Sam clashes with Nick, who then devises a cunning plan for revenge, using Diane as a pawn. American comedy, starring Ted Danson.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert becomes convinced he has found the perfect woman, but Ray witnesses something that makes him think otherwise. Brad Garrett and Ray Romano star.(n)

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie starts wearing glasses and begins to see the family in a new light, while Robert gets back together with Amy and invites her to a Thanksgiving dinner. Doris Roberts, Ray Romano and Brad Garrett star.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles attends a Seattle SuperSonics basketball game with Frasier, where he is plucked out of the crowd at random and offered a big cash prize to sink a half-court shot. David Hyde Pierce stars.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Roz asks Frasier to narrate her documentary on the history of space travel - but he makes such a hash of it she ends up getting rid of him and recruiting former astronaut John Glenn instead. Meanwhile, Niles tries to relive his childhood by entering a kite-flying competition.(n)

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles and Frasier search for a wealthy patron prepared to give their old school a much-needed cash injection, and soon find the ideal candidate - Martin's new girlfriend. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce, with Barbara Babcock (Hill Street Blues).(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Sheffield, design and technology teacher Claire hopes her Asian menu will impress all of her guests but she's got a job on her hands with former-chef-turned-supermarket-worker Simon. Meanwhile, Helen's eccentricity irritates the others, including professional singer Ivor. It's an evening packed with spicy food, a dash of plasticine modelling and a sprinkling of offensive comments.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Design and technology teacher Claire hosts the second day of the competition in Sheffield, and hopes her Asian-inspired menu with a spot of clay model-making will impress her fellow diners enough to net her the points she'll need to secure the cash prize. However, former chef Simon Hollings proves difficult to faze, and the eccentric Helen irritates the other contestants with another audacious display at the dinner table.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Service administrator Monika hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Sheffield. She treats her guests to a traditional Bulgarian night inspired by her homeland, in the hope of impressing them enough to win the £1,000 prize money. However, some of the guests are unsure about her Bulgarian delicacies, and the host must fight for control when the two teachers go head to head and when Simon makes sexist jokes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: After tensions arose between Claire and Helen on Monika's night, 1980s musician Ivor is determined to serve up some fun on his evening in Sheffield. He stages an '80s extravaganza, including a live performance from his new romantic band My Pierrot Dolls.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former chef Simon hosts the final meal in Sheffield, but is unlikely to get an easy ride from his guests following all the criticism he has dished out at the earlier soirees. He also has to contend with the feud that's brewing between Claire and Helen, and when things boil over between the women, Monika doesn't know where to hide.(n)

programme.title: The Steph Show
programme.desc: Steph McGovern presents the daily programme broadcast live from her living room. Guests include South African dancer Oti Mabuse and her former BBC Breakfast colleague Bill Turnbull.(n)

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sharon and Steve Garner help adventurous Cambridge couple Lindsay and Gary find a holiday home in Almería that they can eventually retire to. In Alicante, Damon's clients are childhood sweethearts Lana and Pete from Edinburgh, who are looking for a winter bolthole to suit them, their grandchildren and their precious puppy.(n)

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with guest Dave Myers in Dictionary Corner.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Home or Away
programme.desc: Chris and Kay from Buckinghamshire are searching for their perfect retirement home to share with their two cats. The only hitch is that they can't agree on where it should be. Kay loves the stunning scenery of Cardigan Bay in west Wales, while sun-worshipper Chris would rather move to the beautiful Mar Menor in Spain. Jasmine Harman selects three properties for their £150,000 budget in Wales, but Jonnie Irwin has three cracking options in the Mar Menor.(n)

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Billy, Gwendoline and Michael finally hope to move into their chateau so they can host a hen party, although the kitchen's unfinished. In the Loire Valley, Paul and Karen rent out their chateau as a holiday gite hoping to attract more guests by creating an office in an old water tower. Meanwhile, Dick and Angel try to keep costs down when shopping for baths.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fish salesman Dean is last to host the group of candidates based in and around Essex. He feels none of the meals served to him have met required standards and firmly believes his restaurant style menu will help bag him the £1,000. However, his choice of main course surprises the others and some of the ingredients in the starter are unexpected too.(n)

programme.desc: The story of VE Day in 1945, told through the eyewitness accounts and cine films of ordinary people. Amateur film-makers recorded remarkable scenes, with some of it in glorious colour. Now, rarely seen footage, captured by amateurs and stored away for decades, charts the extraordinary events of May 8 when the entire nation took to the streets. In Galicia, the gorges, coastline and sea bridges are a sight for sore eyes, and a speciality cider tour refreshes the train's guests. The journey ends in Ferrol, a spectacular harbour that has been a major shipbuilding centre for most of its history and has been a key city in many wars. Narrated by Bill Nighy.(n)

Tony also gets to see behind the scenes at the famous Ice Hotel, a structure which is rebuilt every year from ice taken from the nearby Torne river and ends his journey at Miniature Wonderland - the world's largest model railway.(n)

programme.desc: Jane McDonald travels along the Danube on one of the most luxurious ships of its type, as she makes a foray into the realms of the river cruise Beginning in Budapest, Jane heads to the Szechenyi Baths, where she indulges in a game of chess. Afterwards, a visit to the Second World War memorial Shoes on the Danube Bank, leaves her in tears. Heading onwards to Vienna, the presenter is all set to meet a real-life princess. programme.title: The Queen's Speeches: In Triumph & Tragedy
programme.desc: Documentary taking a look at a selection of Elizabeth II's most famous speeches and the events that inspired them, including the deaths of Diana, Princess of Wales and the Queen Mother, Britain entering the first Gulf War, and the coronavirus pandemic. Royal experts and insiders provide the context of what has led to these addresses to the nation, revealing what prompted the monarch to take to the airwaves to reassure her subjects, how she managed it, and whether she captured the mood of the public.(n)

programme.title: Funny Women
programme.desc: A celebration of the careers of Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders. The duo started out in the famous Comic Strip troupe of the early '80s before landing their own show on the BBC, which ran for 20 years. Brilliant together, they also enjoyed stunning solo careers, and made two of the biggest hit sitcoms of the 1990s - Absolutely Fabulous and The Vicar of Dibley. The programme features the thoughts of friends and co-stars, including Jools Holland, Sarah Hadland, Helen Lederer and Christopher Biggins.(n)

programme.title: Funny Women
programme.sub-title: The Outrageous Bette Midler: By Her Friends
programme.desc: Celebrity friends and fans, including James Dreyfus, Wayne Sleep, Christopher Biggins, Michelle Visage and Melissa Manchester, pay homage to the actress and singer. This documentary traces Bette Midler's life from her childhood in Hawaii, her residency at a gay New York bathhouse accompanied on piano by a young Barry Manilow, through an astonishing Hollywood career to a recent record-breaking run on Broadway in Hello Dolly. The life of this pint-sized powerhouse is illustrated with rarely seen archive.(n)

programme.title: The Railways That Built Britain with Chris Tarrant
programme.sub-title: How the Railways Won the War
programme.desc: The broadcaster examines the role of the railways during the two global conflicts of the 20th century, keeping vital supply lines open and transporting troops to and from the front. In the First World War, railway works were converted into munitions factories and women were employed for these dangerous jobs and their heroic efforts helped win them the vote, while in the Second World War, they were vital in organising the evacuation of a million children and offered underground shelters from air raids.(n)
